sources.title: 1958 - Machine Gun Kelly - La ley de las armas - Roger Corman
Machine-Gun Kelly
sources.description: Title: Machine-Gun Kelly Summary: The criminal exploits of Public Enemy number 1, George 'Machine-Gun' Kelly, during the 1930s. Directed by: Roger Corman Actors: Charles Bronson, Susan Cabot, Morey Amsterdam Production Company: El Monte Productions Release Date: May 1958 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Machine-Gun Kelly, the famous bank robber, seldom without his Thompson machine gun. The story opens with great jazzy music and a murder shown in shadows. His moll is the driving force behind his exploits. He has an exaggerated fear of death and death symbols. The sight of a coffin makes him freeze during a bank job, causing his lieutenant to lose his arm. Finally, the gang kidnaps a little girl along with her nurse and hold them for ransom.

sources.title: Machine-Gun Kelly (1958)
sources.description: George Kelly is angry at the world and scared to death of dying. A career bank robber, Kelly gets his confidence from his Thompson SMG and his girl Flo. After a botched robbery, Flo, Kelly and his gang try their hand at a more lucrative job: kidnapping. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/machine-gun-kelly-1958/
